page.title: 03TOURISM IN SOUTH DEVON cont
page.content: Germany,and one family from Italy was actually going to our school (Battisborough)for an interview! We asked why people had chosen to come here and found that most had come for the beach,closely followed by the scenery;some could give no reason.The main drawback of the area mentioned by visitors was its lack of shops,petrol stations and places to eat.Some said that they thought that the roads were dangerous.Several visitors from upcountry said that the weather was better here than elsewhere in the country,though this Summer (1985) has so far been terrible! Tourists coming from outside of the Plymouth area were asked where they were staying.None were staying in our D-Block.20% were staying in caravan sites fairly nearby,25% in hotels or Bed and Breakfast in or
